com.hdcookbook.grin.features
Class Translator

java.lang.Object
  com.hdcookbook.grin.Feature
      com.hdcookbook.grin.features.Modifier
          com.hdcookbook.grin.features.Translator
All Implemented Interfaces:
SetupClient
public class Translator
extends Modifier

A Translator wraps other features, and adds movement taken from a Translation to it. The upper-left hand corner of the subfeature is made to follow the path of the TranslatorModel.

Author:
Bill Foote (http://jovial.com)
See Also:
TranslatorModel

initialize

public void initialize()
Description copied from class: Modifier
Initialize this feature. This is called on show initialization. A show will initialize all of its features after it initializes the phases.

Overrides:
initialize in class Modifier

destroy

public void destroy()
Description copied from class: Modifier
Free any resources held by this feature. It is the opposite of setup; each call to setup() shall be balanced by a call to unsetup(), and they shall *not* be nested.

It's possible an active phase may be destroyed. For example, the last phase a show is in when the show is destroyed will probably be active (and it will probably be an empty phase too!).

Overrides:
destroy in class Modifier

nextFrame

public void nextFrame()
Description copied from class: Feature
Called from Segment with the Show lock held, to advance us to the state we should be in for the next frame.

Overrides:
nextFrame in class Modifier

addDisplayAreas

public void addDisplayAreas(RenderContext context)
Description copied from class: Feature
Add all of the areas that are displayed for this feature with the current frame. This will be called exactly once per frame displayed on each activated feature.

A feature that displays something needs to maintain a record of it in a DrawRecord. The animation framework uses this to track what needs to be erased and drawn from frame to frame.

Overrides:
addDisplayAreas in class Modifier
Parameters:
context - The context for tracking rendering state
See Also:
DrawRecord
